statement.tex: \text{Differentiate the following with respect to x.}\\ \qquad f(x) = \log (\log x), x\gt 1

step.context: \text{Why is the }x\gt 1\text{ in the question}\\ \text{important - if at all?}
step.tex: \log (\log x)\text{ is defined only if }\log x\gt 0.\\ \text{And }\log x\gt 0\text{ only if }x\gt 1.\text{That is why.}
\text{It is probably not. These things are written}\\ \text{just to confuse students.}

step.reason: \text{We have simply applied the Chain Rule to find f'(x).}\\ \text{Also, used the standard result - }\dfrac{d}{dy}\log y = \dfrac{1}{y}.
